title: SWITCH_X Function Module
description:
SWITCH_X is an interface for up to 6 push-buttons. The individual buttons

are debounced with T_DEBOUNCE and switch the respective outputs Q1 to

Q6. IN3 to IN6 are directly connected to the outputs when they be opera￾ted alone. IN1 and IN2 generate a pulse for one cycle after they are pres￾sed. If one of the inputs IN3 up to N6 is pressed during input IN1 or IN2 is

operated , then no output pulse passed to Q1 to Q6, but the corresponding

output Q31 to Q62 is activated. Q42, for example, is activated if IN4 is

operated while IN2 is operated. Q2 and Q4 are then inactive.

SWITCH_X thus allows the inputs IN3 to IN6 to realize a triple occupancy

and select it by pressing IN1 or IN2 and a further input.

59 Version 1.00

Chapter 6. Electrical Engineering
name: SWITCH_X

input.name: IN1
input.description: Push button input 1. Generates a pulse for one cycle after it is pressed.

input.name: IN2
input.description: Push button input 2. Generates a pulse for one cycle after it is pressed.

input.name: IN3
input.description: Push button input 3. Directly influences output Q3.

input.name: IN4
input.description: Push button input 4. Directly influences output Q4.

input.name: IN5
input.description: Push button input 5. Directly influences output Q5.

input.name: IN6
input.description: Push button input 6. Directly influences output Q6.

output.name: Q31
output.description: Output activated if IN1 or IN2 is pressed while IN3 is activated.

output.name: Q32
output.description: Output activated if IN1 or IN2 is pressed while IN4 is activated.

output.name: Q41
output.description: Output activated if IN1 or IN2 is pressed while IN5 is activated.

output.name: Q42
output.description: Output activated if IN1 or IN2 is pressed while IN6 is activated.
